data.text: Better it is to have no children, and to have virtue:
When it is present, men take example at it;
But the multiplying brood of the ungodly shall not thrive,
For though they flourish in branches for a time;
The imperfect branches shall be broken off,
For children begotten of unlawful beds
But though the righteous be prevented with death,
For honorable age is not that which standeth in length of time,
But wisdom is the gray hair unto men,
He pleased God, and was beloved of him:
Yea, speedily was he taken away, lest that wickedness should alter his understanding,
For the bewitching of naughtiness doth obscure things that are honest;
He, being made perfect in a short time, fulfilled a long time:
For his soul pleased the Lord;
This the people saw, and understood not,
Thus the righteous that is dead shall condemn the ungodly which are living;
For they shall see the end of the wise,
They shall see him, and despise him;
For he shall rend them, and cast them down headlong, that they shall be speechless;
And when they cast up the account of their sins, they shall come with fear:
